definition: to fish by casting a net/to capture/to surround and seize
to encircle/to surround/all around/to wear by wrapping around (scarf, shawl)

sentences.english: They are trying to round up those robbers.
sentences.chinese: 他們正在努力圍捕那些強盜。

sentences.english: Adults too can be victims of cyber-bullying and stalking.
sentences.chinese: 成年人也同樣會受到網絡威脅和圍捕的威脅。

sentences.english: On the basis of the above analysis, the suggestions have been made on purse seine design and fishing operation.
sentences.chinese: 在此基礎上對圍網設計和圍捕操作提出了一些建議。

sentences.english: Many were retirees who care for stray felines they said were being rounded up by dealers.
sentences.chinese: 許多人退休誰照顧流浪貓，他們說，被圍捕的經銷商。

sentences.english: Be in in round, case group will escape to the Lan Xiaojun of remote mountains to subdue eventually.
sentences.chinese: 在一次圍捕中，專案組終將逃到深山的蘭小軍制服。

sentences.english: Fishermen caught grey mullet near the inshore area.
On the basis of the above analysis, the suggestions have been made on purse seine design and …
sentences.chinese: 在此基礎上對圍網設計和圍捕操作提出了一些建議。

sentences.english: Team see the time is ripe, immediately start mobilizing police officer.
sentences.chinese: 專案組見時機成熟，馬上調集警力展開圍捕行動。

sentences.english: The malefactors in the robbery were rounded up by the police and sent to jail.
sentences.chinese: 那個搶案的罪犯被警方圍捕並被逮捕入獄。

sentences.english: Fishermen catching grey mullet near the inshore area.

definition: (of police etc) to stop (sb) for inspection/to pull (sb) over
Kanting township in Pingtung County 屏東縣|屏东县[Ping2 dong1 Xian4], Taiwan
dangers spring up all around (idiom); surrounded by perils
to hunt and kill (an animal or fish)
to escort (goods or funds)/to convey under guard
